Description: Four teenagers, one of whom died, were shot at the end of a graduation party at a brewpub.
Four people, including a teenager, were shot in the Clay Arsenal neighborhood.
Four people were shot after a fight in the Broad Ripple neighborhood during the early morning.
One person was killed, and seven others were injured during a shooting in the northwest part of the city in the early morning.
Seven people were shot when someone opened fire into a crowd during a fight in the Central Business District during the early morning.
A person shot four people in two different locations who were later transferred to hospitals. No motive has been established.
Following an argument at a bar earlier in the morning between two groups, one of the groups opened fire at the residence the other group was at, leaving five injured.
Multiple people opened fire during a party at an unlicensed bar, leaving one dead and four others injured.
A teenager was killed, and three other people were injured when multiple people opened fire on a group outside an apartment.
One person was killed, and three others were injured in a shooting at an intersection between the Corlett and Lee-Miles neighborhoods.
A teenager was killed, and four other people were hurt during a shooting in the northwest part of the city.
A shooting at an apartment complex injured four teenagers. Two of the victims were airlifted to a nearby children's hospital.

An argument in the Walbrook neighborhood led to at least one person opening fire, killing two and injuring two others. The suspects carjacked a vehicle in an attempt to escape before crashing the car into another vehicle.
A teenager killed three of his siblings and then himself, while the parents and a fifth sibling were not at home at the time of the shooting.
Four people were shot in a residential neighborhood, one of whom died.
Four people, including three teenagers, were shot outside a townhome in the northwest part of the city. One teenager and one adult died.
Four men walking along the road in the Faubourg Lafayette neighborhood were shot shortly after midnight.
An argument among a group of people led to a man opening fire in the city's Northwest side, killing another man, and injuring two teens before being shot by one of the victims.

When concerned family members checked on a man at his trailer home, they were met with gunfire, with the man fatally shooting his mother and injuring another woman. Responding police entered the trailer and were fired upon, leaving one deputy dead and another suffering a non-gunshot injury to the leg. The man killed himself, and the trailer home burned down.
Two people were killed and five others injured during a shooting at a car show in Peck Park in the San Pedro neighborhood.
One person was killed and three others injured after a shooting in the Meadowbrook neighborhood.
Eight people, including at least two teenagers, were shot during a drive-by shooting at a Shell gas station in the Loring Heights neighborhood.
One person was killed and three others injured during a shooting at a nightclub.
Five men were shot in the McGuire Manor neighborhood shortly before midnight.
Shortly before midnight, a man opened fire on a group of people in the Back of the Yards neighborhood, leaving four injured.
Four people were shot during a large party at a home in the east side during the early morning.
A man got out of a black truck and opened fire with a rifle on a group of people in the East Garfield Park neighborhood, leaving four people injured.
Seven people were shot, one fatally, shortly after midnight behind a concert hall.
Five people were shot on a road during the early morning, one of whom died.
Nine people were shot during a party in the Northside neighborhood.
A shooting during a gathering at a closed park left two dead and two others injured.

Maquoketa Caves State Park shooting: A man shot and killed three members of a family, including a child, as they were in their tent in Maquoketa Caves State Park before committing suicide in an apparent random attack.
Two men shot four people standing outside a CVS in the Historic Core.
Four people, including a teenager, were shot in the Hartley neighborhood.
Multiple people opened fire during a gathering in the Thomasville Heights neighborhood in the city's southeast side, wounding five, including at least one teenager.
Four people were shot, one fatally, at a park.
An off-duty North Las Vegas police officer fatally shot his daughter and wounded his son and wife before committing suicide.
Four teenagers were shot in the Broadway neighborhood.

Seven people were injured in downtown Denver by Denver Police who were "going after a suspect  claimed to have seen with a gun in a crowded area of the city's downtown." Six of the seven injured were bystanders. An independent monitor from outside the police department has been setup to investigate the shooting.
Greenwood Park Mall shooting: A man shot five people, three fatally, inside the food court of Greenwood Park Mall before being fatally shot by an armed civilian.
Four people were injured in a shooting outside a bar in the Downtown area of Grand Rapids.
Five people were shot during a block party.
Two people were killed, and two others injured during a shooting at a crowded house party in the Harney Heights neighborhood.
Four people, including a teenager, were shot in the Brownsville neighborhood of Brooklyn.
Five people, including three teenagers, were shot after a fight escalated inside a Walmart.
Four people were shot in the parking lot of a nightclub during the early morning hours.
Two teenage brothers opened fire during a memorial, injuring five.
Four people, including a teenager, were shot in the Feltonville neighborhood of North Philadelphia.
Four people were shot, one fatally, in the Edgewood neighborhood.
Four people were fatally shot at an apartment complex following an argument.
Two were killed, and two others were injured in a shooting inside a bar in the Hilltop neighborhood.
Four teenagers were shot near a home in the Poplar neighborhood of North Philadelphia.
Four people were injured in a drive-by shooting in the West Garfield Park neighborhood.
Four people, including a toddler, were shot in the Mill Creek neighborhood of West Philadelphia.
Four people where injured by gunfire in the Folwell neighborhood in the city's north side after an argument ended with shots being fired.
Four teenagers were shot at an apartment complex in the Eagledale neighborhood in the city's west side, with one dying.
Four people were shot in the Lower Roxbury neighborhood.
Four people were shot during a shootout at an apartment complex in the Whitehaven neighborhood.
An argument between two teenagers led to one of them opening fire, leaving four wounded, including the other teenager and a toddler.

Two men robbed six 7-Eleven stores and a Yum-Yum Donuts at gunpoint across Southern California during the early morning hours on "7-Eleven Day". During the robberies, one of the men shot five people at four of the convenience stores, two of whom died. The man who opened fire is also accused of murdering a homeless man in the North Hills neighborhood of Los Angeles two days earlier.
A shootout between several gunmen and three off-duty police officers working security at a bar just outside it left one dead and five others injured.
Five people were shot while on the Coney Island boardwalk in Brooklyn.
Four people were shot near a bar in the Near North Side neighborhood during the early morning hours.
A man shot his wife, mother-in-law, and teenage son before fatally shooting himself at their home.
While officers dispersed a crowd, a shooting during an informal gathering in a parking lot shortly before midnight left one dead and four others injured.
One man was killed and three others wounded in a shooting during a party being held at a rental property.
Three people were killed and two were wounded in a shootout at a house party.
Four people, including a teenager, were shot while celebrating the city's "Gap Day".
Four men were injured in a drive-by shooting in the Midtown neighborhood.
Four people were shot shortly after midnight on a city street.
Four people were wounded in a drive-by shooting in the East Garfield Park neighborhood.
An argument in an alleyway escalated into a shooting that injured four, including two teenagers.
Four people were shot after three men got out of a car and opened fire on a group of people in the Near West Side neighborbood.
Four people were shot at an intersection in the Jackson Heights neighborhood.
A shooting inside a nightclub left four injured.
Four people were shot, one fatally, in the parking lot of an event center in the Lansingville neighborhood during a shootout.
Shortly after midnight three people were killed and seven injured at a large block party.
Several people opened fire on a crowd of people gathered at a recreation center, leaving one dead and three others injured.
A shooting outside a nightclub killed one and injured four.
Three vehicles engaged in a running gun battle, leaving one dead and three others injured.
Four adults were wounded at a cookout at a home in Rochdale Village, Queens after an unidentified shooter arrived and opened fire. They fled before police arrived.
During a night of civil unrest and several informal Independence Day celebrations, a shooting at Boom Island Park left seven injured.
Five people were shot, one fatally, at a home in the central part of the city.
A shooting in the College View neighborhood left one dead and three others injured.

Highland Park parade shooting: Seven people were killed and 48 others were wounded after a person opened fire from a rooftop on people attending an Independence Day parade. Eleven others were injured fleeing the scene. The shooter also admitted he had plans to drive to Madison, Wisconsin to shoot more people. He was charged with a total of 117 counts later in the month.
Six people were shot during the early morning outside an internet cafe in the Jackson Ward neighborhood.
Five people were hit by celebratory gunfire fired from a nearby neighborhood inside the Oakland Coliseum during a baseball game between the Toronto Blue Jays and Oakland Athletics.
Shortly after midnight, five people, including a teenager, were shot in the Parkway Gardens neighborhood as they stood outside.
Four people were shot at an intersection in the Dorchester neighborhood.
Officers responding to reports of car break-ins heard gunshots, then found four people shot in the downtown area.
A shooter opened fire during a birthday party leaving three men dead and four others wounded.
Four people were shot in the South End neighborhood.
Four people were wounded in a shooting.
A fight in the parking lot of a car wash escalated into a shooting that left four injured.
A drive-by shooting left four adults and two children hospitalized.

A man shot and killed two people at a home before also shooting a neighbor who was calling the police and then opened fire on three police officers as they approached the residence, wounding all three. The shooter fled the scene and later fatally shot himself.
A man opened fire on people on a street in the West Garfield Park neighborhood, leaving four injured.
A drive-by shooting left one dead and seven others injured.
A shooter opened fire inside a mechanic shop that was hosting a party in the Richmond Hill neighborhood of Queens, leaving one dead and three others injured.
An argument outside a nightclub escalated into a shooting that left two dead and injured three others in the Chicago Loop.
Nine people were injured in a shooting.
2022 shooting of Kentucky police officers: A man shot dead three police officers and a police dog and wounded four other people, including three officers.
Four people were injured in a shooting in the Greenville neighborhood.
Four people were shot in the East Germantown neighborhood of Northwest Philadelphia.
One person was fatally shot and two others were injured after a teenager violently forced his way into a home and opened fire. The shooter was also wounded.
One person was killed and three others were injured during a shootout on MS-178.
Five people, included two children, were shot in the Lincoln Heights neighborhood.
An early morning shooting at a party left one dead and seven others injured.
Eight people were shot at a party in South Tacoma.
Five people were wounded after a shooting.
One person was killed and six others wounded after a shooting.
Five people were shot, one fatally.
Five people were shot at a trail ride concert.
During the early morning, a fight at a nightclub escalated into a shootout that left one dead and three injured.
After multiple fights broke out during a gathering, a shooting left four injured, including several uninvolved bystanders, during the late evening hours.
Two men were killed and another two wounded after an argument escalated into a shooting.
Four people, including an eight-year-old boy, were wounded after a man on a dirtbike opened fire on a barbeque in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn.
Four teenagers were shot near railroad tracks, two fatally.
Two were killed and two others wounded after a shootout in the Point Breeze neighborhood.
A shooting killed a woman driving nearby and wounded three others. Six were arrested in connection with the shooting.
Four people were shot, one fatally, near a CTA Red Line station.
One person was killed, and eight others wounded at a late night barbeque party in a park in Harlem.
Five people were shot at a party in the St. George neighborhood of Staten Island.
Five people, including a teenager, were shot while in a car at an intersection between the Coral Way and Coconut Grove neighborhoods.
Two people were killed, and two others injured during a shooting at a nightclub.
Four people were shot in the Burton Heights neighborhood in the city's southeast side.
Four people were shot, one fatally, at an apartment complex and a park in two connected shootings in the Krainz Woods neighborhood.
A teenager was killed and three others, including a police officer, were shot during a concert celebrating Juneteenth in the Cardozo neighborhood.
A family having a barbeque in their front yard was fired upon in a drive-by shooting, leaving two dead and five injured.
Three people standing together in the Sandtown-Winchester neighborhood were shot. A fourth person who was driving by was also hit by gunfire.
Just after midnight five people were shot at a nightclub in Downtown Pensacola.
A group of people standing in a parking lot in the Lake Meadows neighborhood were fired upon, leaving five injured.
Five people were shot, one fatally, in the Civic Center neighborhood.
Four people, including at least one teenager, were shot.
Four people, including a child, were fatally shot in a murder-suicide at an apartment complex.
A man shot fatally a woman and injured her two adult children over an argument about repairing a sink. After shooting them, he shot himself in the foot.
A teenager shot four people during an argument, leaving one paralyzed, before being shot herself.
Three people were killed and four others injured during a shooting at a rapper's birthday party concert in the Boyle Heights neighborhood. Two security guards were wounded.
Six people were shot, two fatally, during a party in the Virginia Village neighborhood.
An argument in the Los Indios neighborhood led to a shooting that killed one and injured three others.
Four people were shot outside a bar in the Mid-City neighborhood.
A domestic incident escalated into a shooting that injured four.
A shooting at a nightclub left two dead and four others wounded.
Two people were shot, two fatally, during a birthday pool party at an apartment complex.
Five teenagers were shot near the Big Four Bridge.
Five people in an alleyway in the Auburn Gresham neighborhood were shot in a drive-by shooting. One victim later died of their injuries.
Four people were injured in a drive-by shooting during a bachelor party being hosted at an Airbnb in the Davison-Schoolcraft neighborhood in the city's northwest side.
Seven people were shot during a party.
An argument at a restaurant led to a shooting that left one person dead and three others injured.

A shooter opened fire at a manufacturing facility, killing three and injuring one before fleeing the scene. Responding officers spotted the fleeing suspect, who engaged in a gun battle with state troopers, leaving the suspect and a state trooper injured.
A gunfight between two cars left four injured.
Four men sitting in the side yard of a house in the Frankford neighborhood were fired upon by a shooter. Two were killed, and the other two were wounded.
Four people were shot on a sidewalk in the North Lawndale neighborhood.
Four people were fatally shot at a home. The fourth victim succumbed to their injuries after a few days.
Four people, including a teenager, were shot near a courtyard in the Altgeld Gardens neighborhood.
Four people were shot, one of them fatally, at an apartment complex after a fight escalated.
Four people were injured in a drive-by shooting shortly before midnight.
Three people were killed and two were wounded by an early morning shooting at a house. The child of a dead pregnant woman was soon delivered by doctors.
Two people were killed and two others injured in a shooting outside a nightclub.
2022 Chattanooga shooting: Fourteen were shot, two of them fatally, at a nightclub during the early morning. A third person was killed by a vehicle attempting to flee.
One person was killed and three others injured in an early morning shooting at the Festival of the Arts.
Five teenagers were wounded in a targeted shooting at an early morning graduation house party after two groups at the party began fighting.

Eight people, including six children, were shot during a graduation party after occupants in two cars opened fire at the partygoers in the yard of the house it was being held at. An adult woman was killed.
A man was fatally shot and three others were wounded beside an apartment building.
Four people were shot, one fatally, at an abandoned home.
A couple was arrested after the boyfriend shot three people during an argument. The boyfriend was also shot.
2022 Philadelphia shooting: Fourteen people were shot, three of them fatally, by multiple shooters on South Street. One of the shooters may have been shot by a responding police officer.
A fight during a party being held at a strip mall escalated into gunfire, with nine people being shot.
Four people were shot, one fatally, shortly before midnight near an apartment complex.
Six people were shot, one fatally, during a party. One of the shooting victims also suffered a broken arm.

Two police officers responding to a domestic disturbance were fired upon by two men. In the ensuing gun battle, a shooter and a police officer were killed. The surviving officer and shooter were both shot.

Centerville shooting: An escaped prisoner broke into the holiday home of a grandfather and his four grandchildren and fatally shot four of them, as well as fatally stabbing one of the grandchildren, before stealing their truck. The prisoner was fatally shot in a gun battle with police later the same day.
Warren Clinic shooting: At least four people were killed and multiple were injured after a shooting inside a building on the Saint Francis Hospital campus. The shooter fatally shot himself.

A concerned relative checked their family at their home and found four of them dead. A man had killed his girlfriend and her two eldest children before committing suicide. Three younger children were found unharmed in the home.
Four people were shot in the Carver neighborhood.
Seven people were shot, one of them fatally, outside a bar and a liquor store during the early morning.
Ten people were shot during a party in a vacant parking lot, including a teenager. A police officer who was arriving at the scene was shot at in his police cruiser and suffered a shrapnel injury.
A shooting at a party in the Port Richmond neighborhood left two dead, including a teenager, and two others wounded.
Seven people were shot on U.S. Route 95, causing the highway to be shut down in both directions for several hours.
Four people were shot in the Willow Springs neighborhood. A victim driving away from the scene fatally struck a motorcyclist.
A man shot four people, one fatally, at a home in the Humboldt Park neighborhood before barricading himself inside during a domestic-related incident. The shooter was eventually shot by a SWAT team.
Four people were shot, one fatally, at a house party during the early morning.
One person was killed and seven others wounded after a shooting at a Memorial Day festival at the Old City Square.
Five people, including a teenager, were shot in the West Garfield Park neighborhood in the early morning.
Six people were shot during a house party.
Four people were shot during an illegal car show between the Hollywood and Hyde Park neighborhoods.
A disturbance between two teenagers at a house party escalated into a shooting that wounded four after one of the teenagers opened fire shortly before midnight.
Four people were shot, one fatally, in a shooting in a bar parking lot during the early morning hours.
One teenager was killed and three were wounded in a shooting in the McLane neighborhood.
Six people were injured during an exchange of gunfire in the Riverfront neighborhood.
Six people, including several teenagers, were shot at a graduation party.
A man fatally shot his wife and his step-children before non-fatally shooting himself in the head.
Four people were shot, including two teenagers, while on the way to a prom party in the Mantua neighborhood.

Robb Elementary School shooting: An 18-year-old shot his grandmother at their home before driving to Robb Elementary School, where he entered the school unobstructed, barricading himself inside a classroom and fatally shooting twenty-one people, including nineteen children. Eighteen people in total were wounded. The shooter was eventually fatally shot by a Border Patrol officer, which was shot during the shootout.
Five people were shot during a memorial service in the Collinwood neighborhood.
Five people were injured in an early morning shooting at a nightclub. Several others were injured by broken glass during the chaos of the shooting.
A man fatally shot his two teenage daughters and his wife before shooting himself.
Police discovered five people shot to death at a public housing complex in the Caimito barrio.
A drive-by shooting in the South End area left four wounded.
A shooting occurred at a home, leaving two people dead and three injured.
A drive-by shooting in front of a grocery store wounded three and killed one.
Four people were shot, one fatally, in the Holy Cross neighborhood.
A shooting occurred at an after-prom party, leaving one dead and nine injured.

Magnificent Mile shooting: An individual opened fire during an altercation between two groups of teenagers, killing two and injuring eight. The shooter engaged in a chase with police in the subway, during which a woman fell onto the train tracks and was electrocuted during the chaos.
An estranged husband opened fire on his wife, killing her, their daughter, and his mother-in-law before committing suicide.
Five people were shot in the Cecil B. Moore neighborhood, including a teenager.
Four people were shot, one of them fatally, at a park in a targeted attack.
Two teenagers and two juveniles were shot at a house in the Shepard Street–South Road Street Historic District.
Two people were killed, and three others were injured, at a flea market after an argument escalated into a shooting in the Meadowviewland neighborhood.
Seven people were shot in three connected shootings that preceded an exchange of gunfire.
Five people were shot at a nightclub in the morning, with one person dying.
2022 Laguna Woods shooting: A man motivated by anti-Taiwanese sentiment opened fire at a church, killing one and wounding five others, before being physically restrained by churchgoers.
2022 Buffalo shooting: An 18-year-old white supremacist clad in body armor opened fire at a Tops supermarket, killing ten, including a security guard, and wounding three others.
Two people were killed, and three were injured, in a shooting in the Deep Ellum neighborhood.
A gunfight among several groups of people wounded seventeen people following an NBA game in the East Town neighborhood.
A fight outside a convention center following a high school graduation ceremony led to a shooting that injured four. No students or graduates were involved in the shooting or the fight.
A teenage girl was killed, and four men wounded, in a shooting in the Sandy Hill neighborhood.
Four people, including a teenager and a baby, were injured in an ambush while they drove in a car in the Mark Twain neighborhood. One of the adult victims later succumbed to his injuries.
Four people, including two teenagers, were shot along the Canal Walk after two groups of people began shooting at each other across the water following an argument.
Four people, including two children, were shot while they drove together in a vehicle in the West Englewood neighborhood.
Six people were shot by two men in a drive-by shooting in the Jackson Park neighborhood on the South Side.
A shooter shot four people, one fatally, before fleeing and sparking a manhunt.
Five people were shot during a confrontation between two groups after at least one of the groups opened fire in northwestern Baltimore.
Four people were shot, including two teenagers, in the Kensington neighborhood.
Four people were shot, one fatally, in the Milton-Montford neighborhood.
Five teenagers outside in the Back of the Yards neighborhood on the South Side were shot, one fatally, by multiple occupants of a stolen vehicle.
An argument in the common area of an apartment complex led to a shooting that injured five.
A fight amongst a group of people in the Chandler Park neighborhood on the city's east side led to four people, including three teenagers, being shot.
Three people were killed, and another three were injured, in a shooting at a condominium complex. The shooter has not been found.
A shooting during the very early morning killed two, and wounded three.
A shooting outside a house party left two teenagers dead, and two others injured, shortly before midnight.
A fight during an informal car meet among a group of people led to a shooting that injured four, including two juveniles.
A shooting in the Village de L'Est neighborhood left two killed, and four others wounded.

During a Cinco de Mayo festival, a gang member shot at a member of a rival gang who was in a crowd of people, wounding five bystanders--including four children. The shooting prompted the cancellation of the event. A 13-year old boy has now been arrested as the suspected shooter.
Three people were shot in the Chicago Loop as they sat at a red light at an intersection by two people. Another person was shot by a stray bullet as they crossed the street.
Five people were injured in a shooting incident during the evening.
An unknown shooter opened fire through an apartment window, and wounded five people.
A shooting at a casino in Kaw Nation territory wounded four.
A party being held at a park ended in gunfire, with four people being shot. One person succumbed to their injuries.
Five people were shot, one fatally, on a street in the early morning.
An argument among a group of people led to someone opening fire, wounding six.
Officers responding to shots fired engaged an active shooter and shot the attacker. Eleven people were shot before police stopped the shooter.
A fight in the Rosedale Heights neighborhood led to a shooting that killed one, and injured four others.
A shooting by multiple people at a festival wounded five. One of the shooters was fatally shot by a responding officer.
A shootout at a bar between two groups of people wounded six people in the 11th Ward neighborhood.
A shooting at a party injured four.
Two people were killed, and three others were injured, after a fight between two biker gangs led to a gunfight in a bar parking lot in the Fountain City neighborhood.
Four teenagers were shot, two fatally, in a drive by shooting.
A woman was killed, and three other people were injured, including a teenager, in a revenge shooting.
An argument between two men escalated into a shooting that killed a young girl, and another man. Three children, including a toddler, were also shot.
Four people, including a teenager, were wounded in a drive-by shooting in the West Garfield Park neighborhood.
During the filming of a music video at a barber shop, at least one person opened fire from a passing vehicle, wounding four. A fifth person was injured while trying to flee.
Four people were shot during an argument in the Maryvale Village neighborhood.

A man fatally shot three people, including the owner, at a motel in Biloxi before fleeing westward to Gulfport. In Gulfport, he fatally shot another man and carjacked his vehicle, before barricading himself inside a convenience store. The shooter assaulted two employees of the convenience store, but they escaped unharmed, after which he barricaded himself inside an office. The shooter set a fire in the room which caused him to die of smoke inhalation.
Three teenagers were fatally shot on a road in northwest Rock Hill. Another person was shot but survived.
A shooting at a gathering at a Shell gas station wounded three people, and killed one.
A fight at a house party led to six people being shot, with two dying from their injuries.
Four people were shot, one fatally, during the early morning hours.
A fight at a sports bar led to a shooting that injured four during the early morning hours in the Goldest East neighborhood.
Five people were shot, one fatally, in a shooting at a bar in the Muscupiabe neighborhood.
Five people were shot in the Hotel District neighborhood during the late night hours.
Four people were shot, two fatally, in a drive-by shooting in the West Englewood neighborhood.

A 23-year old man shot at random people at Edmund Burke School from his apartment with a sniper-style set-up, wounding four—including a child, in the Forest Hills neighborhood. The man committed suicide as officers entered his apartment.
Four people were injured in the Walnut Hills neighborhood.
Four people were injured in a shooting during the night in central Petersburg.
A man shot to death his parents and another couple a quarter-mile apart from each other inside their homes.
A man shot four of his family members, including two children, as they slept before shooting himself.
A man shot his girlfriend and their two young children before shooting himself.
Four people were shot in the Fairhill neighborhood.

2022 Pittsburgh shooting: An early morning shooting at a party held at an Airbnb rental property in the East Allegheny neighborhood killed two juveniles, and wounded nine others. Five people sustained injuries such as broken bones and cuts when they jumped out windows to escape the gunfire.
A shooting at an Easter party being hosted at a nightclub wounded nine.
A shooting in the Parkway neighborhood wounded three, and killed one, during the early morning hours.
One teenage boy died, and three others are in a hospital, after a shooting in the Centennial neighborhood.
Five people were shot during the late evening hours.
A fight at an Easter party being held at a home ended in gunshots, with a man being killed and three others, including two juveniles, being injured.
An argument between two men at a bar escalated, with them opening fire on each other and wounding one another. Two bystanders were also shot.
Four people were shot, including two children, during a house party.
Seven people were shot, one fatally, during a shooting at a pasture party and trail ride.
An exchange of gunfire behind a bar left four wounded.
Shortly after midnight, five people were shot, one fatally, in the Armory Square neighborhood.
A shooting killed one, and injured three others, in northwest Baltimore during the evening.
Columbiana Centre shooting: Nine people were shot, and five others were injured while fleeing a shooting at the Columbiana Centre, after at least one person opened fire.

Police officers responding to reports of a suspicious vehicle found a woman inside a Jeep, who refused to cooperate with officers. She then pulled out a gun when officers attempted to remove her from the vehicle and opened fire, wounding three officers before being fatally shot.
A group of people approached another group and opened fire, killing two and wounding two others in the Pacific neighborhood.
Four people were shot, one fatally, in the Allerton neighborhood of The Bronx.

2022 New York City Subway attack: Ten people were shot when a gunman motivated by black supremacy opened fire on a New York City Subway train as it approached the 36th Street station in the Sunset Park neighborhood. Immediately before the attack, the assailant donned a gas mask and threw smoke bombs. The incident caused 19 others to be injured as they fled. The suspect was arrested the next day.
Police found three people shot at two related shootings, after a victim flagged down a police cruiser.
An early morning shooting at a gathering being held at an apartment complex killed one, and injured five.
A fight at a birthday party being held at an event venue erupted into gunfire, with five people being injured, and another person being killed, both in and outside the building.
First responders found two men dead, and four others injured, after a shooting.
A targeted shooting at a nightclub wounded ten, and killed two, after two men opened fire in the Oakhill Jackson neighborhood.

A fight inside a bar in the Wingate neighborhood spilled outside, where multiple men pulled out firearms and opened fire at each other, resulting in the death of one man, and injuries to three others.
Four people were shot outside a convenience store in the Model City neighborhood during the early morning.
A shooting carried out by two men across multiple blocks wounded four, including two teenagers.
A man fatally shot his estranged wife, a relative, and another person in a home before shooting himself.

A man shot two women in the Frankford neighborhood before being pursued by police to an apartment building, where he barricaded himself inside and engaged in a gunfight with police. The man wounded a SEPTA police officer before fatally shooting himself.
Four people were shot, one of them fatally, in the Clay Arsenal neighborhood.
A large fight involving multiple juveniles erupted into gunfire. A shooter wounded three juveniles, and an adult man.

During a concert just after midnight, a person fired a shot into the air, and immediately afterward, another person opened fire into the crowd of concertgoers. Sixteen people were shot, including three teenagers, and one person died.
Four people were shot, two fatally, near a playground in the Crocker-Amazon neighborhood.

2022 Sacramento shooting: A shootout between the Crips and Bloods, and the Bloods' local ally the G-Mobb gang, ended with one member of each gang being killed, and one Crips member being injured. Three bystanders were killed, while another eleven were wounded.
Four people were shot as they left a party in the Willert Park neighborhood in the early morning.

A man opened fire inside a home in Parkin, killing one and wounding another. Responding police spotted him as he drove west away from the scene, leading to a chase that ended in Wynne, where he engaged in a gunfight, wounding a police officer before being fatally shot.
Five people were shot in two related shootings in the same neighborhood. Four people were shot in the first shooting, and a fifth was shot in the other.
Five people were shot, one fatally, in the parking lot of a bar in the early morning.
Four people were shot in an early morning shooting outside a bar. One person was found dead by responding police.
Four people were shot behind a bar, one fatally, just after midnight.
An argument led to a gunfight that injured five near midnight.
Police officers responding to a home robbery were fired upon by the suspect, who wounded two, and killed one. Officers returned fire and killed the suspect.
A motorist fleeing a traffic stop opened fire as he was being pursued by police, wounding three officers, before being shot by an officer at the end of a car chase.
A shooting during an illegal street-racing event in the St. Johns neighborhood wounded four, including two teenagers, and one child. The suspect, an adult male, was also injured.
A shooting at an intersection in the Little Woods neighborhood killed two, and injured two others.
A drive-by shooting in northern Hollister killed two, and injured three.

An argument between two groups of people outside a bar in Northwest Virginia Beach just after midnight led to a shooting that injured four. Officers nearby responded and fired at one of the shooters, but they escaped uninjured.
A shooting at a downtown nightclub during the early morning hours wounded four.
A fight outside The Citadel mall during the late evening escalated into a shooting that killed two, and wounded two others.
An argument between two groups of people at a Tanger Outlets mall led to a shooting that injured five, including a child and two teenagers.
An attempted burglary at a home led to a gunfight, with two residents being injured, and two robbers being injured.
Four men, including a teenager, were shot in a parking lot just after midnight in the Valley Oak neighborhood. The teenager died as he was frantically driven to a hospital by a family member.
Four men were shot by someone who approached them and opened fire as they stood on the sidewalk in the South Shore neighborhood. Two of the victims later died from their injuries.
Four people were shot outside of a bar after an altercation.

Four teenagers were shot outside another teen's birthday party being held at a production studio, with one dying from their injuries. The shooting was sparked by an argument in the parking lot of the studio.
Four people were shot at the annual SXSW festival in Downtown Austin.
Crossfire between two gunmen injured 10 victims from a crowd of 1,000 spring break celebration attendees at the 'Space Dallas' party hall.
An argument at a party led to someone opening fire, wounding four people, in the Franklin Heights neighborhood.
A gunfight between two people at a car show killed one bystander, and wounded 26 others, including five children.
During the early morning hours, five people were shot. A woman was found dead by responding police.
Five people were shot, three fatally, in the parking lot of a Baymont Inn in the Terry Sanford neighborhood.
Five people were shot, one fatally, during the early morning hours in Downtown Norfolk.
Ten people were shot during a drive-by shooting outside a party venue in the South Dallas neighborhood.
Four people were shot at a party being hosted at a house in the Far Greater Northside Historical neighborhood, with one dying.
Five people, including a baby, were shot in a drive by shooting. The baby and another person were critically injured.
Gunfire erupted at a party being held in a parking lot being held in the Eastside neighborhood. Four people were injured.

As a Broward County Transit bus traveled westward along Broward Boulevard to the Fort Lauderdale Police Department, a shooter opened fire inside, killing two, and wounding two others. The shooting caused the bus driver to hop the median and drive on the wrong side of the road as she drove frantically towards the police station, striking an SUV and taxi cab along the way, injuring three others. The shooter surrendered to responding police.
Four people were shot in a drive-by shooting in the West Garfield Park neighborhood, including a child.
A shooter opened fire on a group of men standing outside a market in northern Irvington during the late-night hours, killing one, and injuring three.
As a car idled at an intersection, another car pulled up to it and someone inside opened fire, wounding five people inside.

An attempted negotiation between a man and suspected thieves, who he thought stole a gun and cash from his car three days earlier, escalated into a gun battle after one of the suspects shot the man before the man returned fire and killed the suspect. As an employee of the man tried to render first-aid to the first suspect, a second suspect shot them before being shot themselves.
A man shot three people, killing one, in the Glenwood Hills neighborhood. Responding police were attacked by the shooter, who injured two officers, before being shot and killed himself.
A fight among a large group of teenagers at a park in southwest Reading led to gunfire, wounding three, and killing one. All of the victims were students of Governor Mifflin School District.
In the early morning hours at a hookah bar, four people were shot—two fatally, in the Brown Square neighborhood.

An early morning shooting during a party being held at an apartment lead to the death of a woman, and injuries to four others, including two teenagers. The apartment complex is located just off the campus of the University of South Carolina, but no students were shot.
A car pulled up to a group of people outside a Little Caesars in South Chicago and someone in the vehicle opened fire, wounding seven people.

Police responding to a shots fired call found a car in the middle of an intersection between the Gwynn Oak and Howard Park neighborhoods with four men shot inside. Three of the men were pronounced dead at a hospital.
Four people were shot, one fatally, in the evening hours in the central part of the city.
Four people were shot, including a security guard, shortly after midnight after a fight broke out at a bar. One of the victims died from their injuries.
Four people were shot at a Quality Inn hotel near the pool in the Peterson neighborhood. A teen boy was found dead by responding police.
Five teenagers were shot by an attacker while they sat in a car in the Oceanway neighborhood. One of the teenagers died from their injuries.

Police officers responding to a disturbance at Northpark Mall were fired upon by a shooter, leaving two officers injured. The perpetrator then fled the scene westward where another shooting between officers and the shooter occurred, leaving another officer injured as well as the attacker. One of the officers, as well as the attacker, died at a hospital later the same day, while another officer died a few days later.
Three people were shot in a car in northwest Knoxville, with a fourth person also being shot a short distance away.
A fight between a group of people spiraled into a shooting that injured five teenagers, one of whom died at a hospital.
A fight at a party being hosted at an OYO Rooms hotel led to four people being shot shortly after midnight.
Half an hour after midnight a man shot five people, killing two. The perpetrator escaped the scene of the shooting, leading to a manhunt.
In the early morning hours, an argument at a home in the Whittier neighborhood escalated into a shooting that killed one, and injured three.
Four people were shot in the Parkway and Cherry Point neighborhood in the early morning hours.
Four people who were dining inside a seafood restaurant in the Phoenix Hill neighborhood were shot in a drive-by shooting.

After a failed car chase to capture car thieves, the criminals crashed the car into the patrol car of another officer who hadn't participated in the earlier car chase. The occupants of the stolen car exited the vehicle and opened fire on the deputy, wounding him. The officer returned fire and wounded the two attackers. A bystander who was in an automotive shop nearby was struck in the leg by gunfire.

Four people were shot when someone in a car opened fire on another car on I-75, wounding three people inside. Another car, whose occupants were not the intended target, was also shot, and one person inside was injured. A fifth victim was also struck by gunfire but was not injured.
A shooting injured three, including a teenager, and killed a man in eastern Glendale.
A dispute between neighbors led to a shooting that injured seven, one fatally, near the Las Vegas Strip.
Four men were shot in the Walbrook neighborhood. One of the victims was found dead in an alleyway by responding police.

A man fatally shot his three children and the children's chaperone, before shooting himself, at a church during a supervised visit. A restraining order against the father prevented him from seeing his children, except for four-hour sessions, in which a friend of the mother had to be present.
An argument at a business in the southeast part of the city led to four people being shot.
An argument between two groups of people at a Dave and Buster's late Sunday night led to shooting that injured four. All of the victims were members of the two groups.

An argument between two men at a hookah bar east of the Las Vegas strip led to the two men opening fire on each other. The subsequent shooting resulted in the death of one, and injuries to thirteen others.
Four people were shot in the southern part of the city, and one victim died at a hospital later the same day.
After the conclusion of a parade, a man fired at people in front of a store from his car, wounding several. Multiple people in the crowd fired back, seriously wounding the attacker.
An exchange of gunfire between people in southwest Albuquerque led to four people being shot, and one victim dying from their injuries.
A shooter inside a car opened fire on the occupants of another car near the entrance of the Mall of Louisiana, killing two of the people inside, and wounding the other two.
Four people were shot and killed in a murder–suicide, including two children in northeastern Granbury.
A shooter opened fire on three people inside a car in the Serna Station neighborhood. A fourth person who was not targeted by the shooter was also struck by gunfire.

A man shot another man at a home in northern Claxton. When two family members of the victim arrived on the scene to check on him, the shooter shot them in their car, and was promptly shot by responding police.

A man ambushed another man, some of his family members, and a neighbor who was a police officer in the victim's backyard due to a feud with his target. The deputy, who was not shot, returned fire and killed the shooter.
Multiple shooters opened fire outside a funeral home hosting a memorial for a gun violence victim in the West Side neighborhood, resulting in the death of a man, and injuries to three others.
A child was killed in a drive-by shooting targeting a group of people playing basketball at a park. Four others were injured.
A shooting at a grocery store in the Prospect Hill neighborhood left four injured, including a teenager.
Four people were shot in a car in southeast Portland, with the female driver being killed. Among the injured were two young children.
An argument at a party being held at an abandoned building led to a shooting that injured fourteen, and killed two.
A man shot seven people outside a bar in the early morning hours in a targeted shooting perpetrated against one of the victims.

Four men were shot at a Campus Apartments complex near North Carolina Central University and Duke University. Two were found dead by responding police, and none of the victims were students of either school.
A shooter opened fire in the food court of University Mall, shooting and injuring a woman. Three others were injured by shrapnel or bullet fragments.

Normandale Park shooting: Near a racial justice protest, a man allegedly confronted a group of protestors and engaged in an argument with them, before pulling out a gun and opening fire, killing one and wounding four others. One of the people in the group allegedly returned fire and wounded the perpetrator.
During a biker event at a nightclub in the MacGregor neighborhood, an argument led to a shootout between patrons, which injured five people. Among the wounded was the club's bouncer.
Four bystanders, including a teen girl, were shot when two men shot at each other outside a RiteAid drugstore in the East Germantown neighborhood.
Three men were wounded, and one was killed, in an ambush-style shooting in the afternoon. Two sedans pulled up alongside them on the street and opened fire.
Four men were shot in northeast Joliet in the evening. One of the men was found dead by responding police.
Officers responding to an early morning shots fired call engaged in a foot chase with an armed man who had shot five people. After an attempted negotiation, he committed suicide.
In the early morning hours, four people were shot in eastern Little Rock, with one person succumbing to their injuries.
Outside an Italian restaurant hosting a party by Justin Bieber, a fight between a group of men escalated when a shooter opened fire, wounding four, including musician Kodak Black.
An argument outside a hookah bar in the early morning hours escalated when a shooter opened fire, wounding four, and killing one.
A driver shot at another car, wounding four people inside in northwest Springfield.

Responding to a call of a woman being shot, a shooter ambushed a responding officer and shot him several times. As a man fled the home with a baby, and officers attempted to aid in protecting the baby, the shooter shot four more officers, with four more being injured by bullet shrapnel. The shooter then barricaded himself inside the home, and was later found dead, along with a female victim.
In the early morning hours, a fight at a bar led to a patron being removed from the building, after which the patron opened fire from outside the bar and wounded four other patrons.

A chance encounter between two rival gangs at an apartment complex in Southwest Fresno escalated into a shootout, with four gang members being shot, including a teenager. Two men died from their injuries.
A shooter fired at a crowd gathered to celebrate the life of a gun violence victim and wounded four, including a child and a teenager, in the Montgomery Place neighborhood.
A physical altercation in the early morning hours at a Bowlero bowling alley led to a shooting, with five people being wounded.
Four people were shot in southern Las Cruces, with two teenagers requiring medical evacuation via helicopter to El Paso.

A man shot four of his own family members, three fatally, in Corsicana before driving to Frost where he shot three more of his own family, killing two, including a child. After his vehicle was remotely shut off via a vehicle monitoring service, the Corsicana SWAT team closed in on his location. Before they could reach him, the shooter shot himself, and later died from his injuries.
Five people, including a college student at nearby Virginia Tech, which went on lockdown, were shot at a hookah lounge. One person succumbed to their injuries.

Five people were wounded, one fatally, by a shooter in a Greyhound bus. The shooter was later apprehended by police at a nearby Walmart after he got into a physical altercation with a customer and took off all his clothes.

A fight between two teenage girls about a Facebook post during a basketball game at Rufus King International High School escalated when a man opened fire, wounding four teenage girls, and an adult woman.
Four people were shot at a motel in the late evening hours. Two of the victims were shot in the motel parking lot, while the other two were shot in their rooms.

An argument escalated into a shooting outside a sports bar in the Vine City neighborhood shortly after midnight, with one person being fatally shot, and three others being injured by gunfire.
A man shot his wife and two children in a murder–suicide at his home.
Five people were shot at a Days Inn hotel in the Forest Hills neighborhood. A woman later succumbed to her injuries.
Two people were fatally shot at a Shell gas station, with three others being wounded.
Six people were found by police shot to death in a home after being called there for a welfare check in the Park West neighborhood.

Four people were fatally shot at a birthday party at a home in the morning in an ambush-style attack. A fifth person was shot but survived their injuries. The woman whose birthday was being celebrated, along with her older sister, were among the deceased.

Four people were shot by an occupant in an approaching vehicle outside an apartment complex in the South End neighborhood while they were in two vehicles. Two of the victims drove away together to Tacoma, where one of them was found dead by police.
Four men were injured when a vehicle approached them and multiple occupants opened fire upon them. The victims returned fire, and the attackers fled.
Four people were wounded after a drive-by shooting at a bar. An off-duty officer returned fire, killing one of the suspects.
Three men, including an on-duty violence-prevention worker, were fatally shot in the Milton-Monford neighborhood. Another man who was shot survived his injuries.

After a man was escorted out of a bar for assaulting his female companion, he drove away, and later returned with a gun and opened fire on the bar's security guards, with three female patrons and one security guard being wounded. A security guard inside the bar returned fire, and killed the shooter.
Four people were shot at a Martin Luther King Jr. Day gathering in the Coliseum Willow Park neighborhood.
Four people, including two teens, were shot in the Benjamin Van Clark Park neighborhood. A woman died from her injuries, and five vehicles were struck by gunfire.

One teen was shot to death, while three other teens were injured while sitting in a car at a gas station.
Two men were found deceased in a crashed car with multiple gunshots. Two other adults in the backseat were wounded.

Two women were killed, and three others wounded, in an early morning shooting.
A teenager was killed, and three adults and another teenager were wounded, in a shooting near Temple University.
A shooter opened fire outside a nightclub, and wounded five.

Four people were wounded at a shooting at a New Years party shortly after midnight.

Four people were wounded in a drive by shooting in North Philadelphia.

Three adults were killed in a home and an infant was found wounded.

An SUV with four deceased adults was found in a local cornfield in Wheeler, Wisconsin. The perpetrator's father followed his son in a vehicle on the way to Wheeler and then gave his son a ride home after his son abandoned the SUV in the cornfield.
Four people were found wounded from a shooting.

Officers responding to a shooting found four individuals who were transported to the hospital. One victim died later at the hospital.
A man and 17-year-old were killed and five others wounded at a block party after the state's quarantine order was lifted.
Six people were shot in a parking lot after an argument escalated.
A shooter pulled up outside a home and opened fire on four men standing on the porch. One was killed and three injured.
Two people were shot and four others wounded by bullet fragments after a shooter opened fire on a crowded beach.
A shooting left one dead and three in critical condition. No suspects have been arrested and the investigation is ongoing.
A fight escalated at a bar, with the perpetrator leaving the bar and driving to the back of the bar and opening fire, wounding four men.
A man was killed and four others injured after a large gathering on a street had a fight escalate into a shooting.
Five men were wounded outside a Jamaican restaurant in the early morning. All were brought to the hospital by private vehicles and have refused to cooperate with police.
A man was killed and three other individuals wounded after shots were fired near a local deli in the early morning.
A man shot and killed his pregnant ex-girlfriend and wounded her sister, mother, and boyfriend before committing suicide after being surrounding by police.
Five men were wounded shortly after midnight.
Five teenagers, aged 18 and 17-years-old, were wounded after a man fired into the apartment from outside the complex.
Police responded to a suspected shooting and found an 18-year-old dead on the sidewalk. Three injured victims were identified later.

A mother and her 15 and 12-year-old daughters were shot and killed by her husband who wounded another daughter before killing himself in a murder-suicide. Another daughter was uninjured and ran for help.
Three people were wounded when an individual opened fire at a party that was hosted at a short term rental. A fourth wounded individual was walking her dog near the home.
Hundreds of people had gathered for a memorial service when multiple shooters began firing wounding thirteen people.
Police responding to a call of shots fired discovered five individuals wounded, including a pregnant woman after an argument had escalated.
Six people were involved in the repossession of a vehicle and one opened fire killing one and injuring four.
One person was killed and four injured in a believed targeted shooting at a gas station.
Shortly before midnight an argument between two men at a bonfire escalated. Six people were wounded.
Officers responding to reports of a shooting shortly after midnight found a woman dead and three other individuals injured.
Three people were killed and one injured near an apartment complex. The shooting is believed to be connected to a hit and run accident just down the road.
Two men and two women were shot in an evening shooting, with one victim in critical condition.
Six people were wounded in an early morning shooting at a block party/protest that was organized by a man to protest "inequitable narratives."
A woman and three men were wounded after a party with multiple motorcycle clubs, had a large fight in the parking lot with multiple shooters.

A man was found wounded at the River Market district, with witnesses stating the shooter opened fire after pulling a gun from his fanny pack. Three children aged, seventeen, sixteen and twelve-years-old were also wounded.
Two men were discovered wounded by responding officers, one of whom later died at the hospital. Two more wounded were identified after transporting themselves to the hospital.
An 8-year-old boy and three men were wounded in the North Lawndale neighborhood. The shooter exited a vehicle and opened fire on the group while they were standing on the sidewalk.
A large group of people were watching fireworks, when a fight broke out after a car hit a pedestrian. Fourteen people were wounded, of which two were declared dead at the hospital.

A 20-year-old opened fire on a group of six people after getting into an altercation and taking a rifle from his father. Four of the group were injured and the 20-year-old and his father were arrested.
An adult and 11-year-old girl were killed shortly after midnight, three others were wounded. Officers believe that there were two shooters.
Shortly after midnight a man was killed and five others were wounded.
Four people were wounded in an early morning shooting, with potentially multiple weapons used.
Five teenagers were wounded shortly after midnight after a shooting occurred at a house party.
A man was killed and three others injured in a parking lot, after leaving an event held by rapper Bankroll Freddie. People were leaving the event when someone fired into the crowd.
At least two people are killed and eight injured, four critically, at a nightclub. No suspects have been arrested.
Two men were killed and four others - two men and two women - were injured in a shooting at a late-night party.
A group of people were traveling in a party bus, when someone opened fire on the vehicle. Four people in the bus were wounded.
A 16-year-old girl and three adults were wounded by gunfire while standing in an alley in the West Side's Fifth City neighborhood in the early morning.
Officers arrived at an early morning fight and heard shots being fired. They later discovered a man killed by the gunfire and three others injured.
Three men waiting at a stop light and were wounded when someone opened fire. Comedian Rickey Smiley's daughter was a passenger in another vehicle and was also wounded.
Shortly after midnight three men and one woman were injured.

Four adults and a 15-year-old boy were injured in an early morning shooting in Inwood, Manhattan.

Four people were wounded in a shooting that involved two vehicles and an additional four people near Perry Park.
Five people were killed in a home, aged between 14 and 41, with a child being uninjured in the violence. Police are treating the incident as a matter of family violence.
Four people were wounded in the cities South End in an early morning shooting.
One individual was killed and four others - including a juvenile - were injured after a fight escalated into a shooting.
Seven people were discovered wounded after police responded to an aggravated assault call. The individuals were wounded in a drive-by shooting after heading to an early morning party.
An 18-year-old athlete who was to play at University of Louisville was killed and four others injured in a late night shooting.
One person was killed and three others injured, with one being 17-years-old, in an early morning shooting.
Three people were killed and one injured in an apartment by two shooters. Due to the lack of forced entry the victims may have known the shooters.
Police responding to a shots fired call found four people injured.
Two men were killed and two injured in a late night shooting.
One man was killed and four others injured after multiple individuals opened fire on a backyard gathering before fleeing in a car and continuing to fire.
Responding police discovered three adults and a juvenile injured by a shooting. An adult later died in the hospital.
A five-year-old girl was killed and three adults wounded after someone shot into an apartment.
Three men and a seventeen-year-old girl were injured after someone shot at them from across the street. The group was standing outside a home in West Garfield Park.
Four people were wounded in a shooting in a parking lot at a local sporting complex and gym located near the Jefferson City High School.
